intro: Ostrya knowltonii, commonly known as the Mexican hop-hornbeam, is a small to medium-sized deciduous tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Betulaceae family, which includes birches, alders, and hickories. The tree is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and finely toothed, ovate leaves that turn yellow in the fall. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are followed by winged fruits that aid in seed dispersal. Ostrya knowltonii is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to a variety of elevational ranges.
